title: datalad install via api does not work outside of dataset
body:
I am using the datalad python api (datalad version 0.14.0 and python 3.8.7) and when I try to install a dataset inside another one, I cannot do it without actively changing into the outer dataset itself:

```python
>>> import datalad.api
>>> datalad.api.create("my_dataset")
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/datalad-tests/my_dataset
[INFO   ] Scanning for unlocked files (this may take some time)
Dataset('/tmp/datalad-tests/my_dataset')
>>> datalad.api.create("my_inner_dataset")
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/datalad-tests/my_inner_dataset
[INFO   ] Scanning for unlocked files (this may take some time)
Dataset('/tmp/datalad-tests/my_inner_dataset')
>>> datalad.api.install(path="inner", source="/tmp/datalad-tests/my_inner_dataset", dataset="/tmp/datalad-tests/my_dataset")
[ERROR  ] clone target path '/tmp/datalad-tests/inner' not in specified target dataset 'Dataset(/tmp/datalad-tests/my_dataset)' [install(/tmp/datalad-tests/inner)]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/tmp/datalad-tests/virtualenv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 482, in eval_func
    return return_func(generator_func)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/tmp/datalad-tests/virtualenv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 470, in return_func
    results = list(results)
  File "/tmp/datalad-tests/virtualenv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 455, in generator_func
    raise IncompleteResultsError(
datalad.support.exceptions.IncompleteResultsError: Command did not complete successfully. 1 failed:
[{'action': 'install',
  'message': ("clone target path '%s' not in specified target dataset '%s'",
              PosixPath('/tmp/datalad-tests/inner'),
              Dataset('/tmp/datalad-tests/my_dataset')),
  'path': '/tmp/datalad-tests/inner',
  'refds': '/tmp/datalad-tests/my_dataset',
  'source_url': '/tmp/datalad-tests/my_inner_dataset',
  'status': 'error',
  'type': 'dataset'}]
```
but doing this works
```python
>>> import os
>>> os.chdir("my_dataset")
>>> datalad.api.install(path="inner", source="/tmp/datalad-tests/my_inner_dataset", dataset="/tmp/datalad-tests/my_dataset")
[INFO   ] Scanning for unlocked files (this may take some time)
Dataset('/tmp/datalad-tests/my_dataset/inner')
```

According to the documentation here <http://docs.datalad.org/en/stable/generated/datalad.api.install.html#datalad.api.install>
```
dataset (Dataset or None, optional) – specify the dataset to perform the install operation on. If no dataset is given, an attempt is made to identify the dataset in a parent directory of the current working directory and/or the path given. [Default: None]
```
shouldn't this command work from outside of the dataset, or do I understand something wrong here?

The same behaviour I see with `datalad.api.uninstall` and `datalad.api.hirni_import_dcm`
